difference-in-differences comparison.reasoning: Difference-in-differences comparison is a specific analytical method used to estimate the causal effects of the EITC programme by comparing treatment households to control groups.
passages: Alternative difference-in-differences (DD) comparison groups compare treatment households with like households in non-EITC counties and ineligible households in the same county.

US Vital Statistics data analysis.reasoning: US Vital Statistics data analysis refers to the method of using comprehensive birth data to assess the impact of the local EITC programme on birth outcomes.
passages: We use US Vital Statistics data for all births in Maryland from 1995-2004 to capture the casual effects of implementing a local EITC programme across households.
